content:
Are you all using std:üßµ:available_onccurrency? It's apparently from a new module in the std.

image.png

Link for the commit: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/6cc91cb3d87fc2342664a0bf498734cdcceda771

The ways I found to see which module this is:

  1. Copy the emoji and paste somewhere.
  2. Inspect the code.

I don't think that this can be disabled.
The only way I've found to work around it is to wrap it in backquotes.
They appear to be backquoted in the picture though...
Oh, interesting. Backquotes seem to solve the problem in PR titles, but not in commit messages inlined in trees.
You can also insert an invisible whitespace somewhere inside that :‚Äéthread:(for instance, I've just inserted it in between the first colon and t, there
I wouldn't insert non-printable characters in the commit titles to work around a whimsical GitHub issue
It is whimsical indeed :upside_down:, but for non-native English speakers, it's not necessarily obvious what that emoji stands for, I guess, as the OP pointed out :shrug:
it does have an alt-text, but it doesn't show up as tooltip for some reason
Oh, it seems browser behavior changed at some point, now it's only the title attribute that shows as tooltip. it used to be title first and alt as fallback.
Oh, I thought missing titles were a Wayland Firefox bug. Might still be, though.
This is on X11. Title does show tooltips (see zulip emojis), alt doesn't.
git log locally is fine. So this is just a rendering issue
